articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Pavel Polityuk
articles.description: Blasts rang out across Ukraine's capital Kyiv and other cities early on Sunday, as Russia staged its biggest missile attack since August and targeted power facilities with the winter setting in, officials said.
articles.title: Russia targets Ukraine's power grid in 'massive' missile strike, officials say

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Dozens of Palestinians were killed or injured in an Israeli strike on a multi-storey residential building in northern Gaza's Beit Lahiya on Sunday, medics told Reuters.
articles.title: Dozens killed and wounded in Israeli strikes across Gaza, medics and Hamas media say

articles.author: Emily Rose
articles.description: The move may further inflame tension between religious and secular Israelis.
articles.title: Israel sends draft orders to more ultra-Orthodox

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: Joe Biden meets Chinese president Xi Jinping for the last time as U.S. president on Saturday, but the leaders' goal of lowering tensions before Donald Trump's inauguration is challenged by fresh conflicts over cyber crime, trade, Taiwan and Russia.
articles.title: Biden, Xi set for tense final meeting in Peru as Trump era looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said his conversation with Vladimir Putin on Friday had given no indication of a shift in the Russian President's thinking on the war in Ukraine but defended his much-criticised decision to phone the Kremlin.
articles.title: Putin's views on Ukraine war haven't changed, Germany's Scholz says

articles.author: Jake Spring, Lisandra Paraguassu
articles.description: Diplomatic tensions over global warming will take center stage at the G20 summit in Brazil this week, as negotiators at U.N. talks in Azerbaijan hit an impasse on climate finance that they hope leaders of the world's 20 major economies can break.
articles.title: World looks to G20 in Rio for breakthrough in climate talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A former student went on a stabbing rampage at a vocational college in eastern China, killing eight people and injuring 17, police said on Sunday, just days after the deadliest mass killing in the country in a decade shocked Chinese society.
articles.title: Eight killed in second mass attack in China in a week

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Bangladesh is battling its worst outbreak of dengue in years, with more than 400 deaths as rising temperatures and a longer monsoon season drive a surge in infections, leaving hospitals struggling to cope, particularly in urban areas.
articles.title: Bangladesh deaths from dengue cross 400 as outbreak worsens

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Senegal headed to the polls on Sunday to vote in legislative elections that the president hopes will give his party a clear majority and the means to implement an ambitious agenda for reforms.
articles.title: Senegal votes for lawmakers in test for new president

articles.author: Felix Onuah
articles.description: Nigeria and India on Sunday agreed to deepen collaboration in maritime security, intelligence and counter-terrorism during a state visit to the West African country by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
articles.title: Nigeria and India agree deeper ties in maritime security, counter-terrorism
